definition: to leak electricity/(fig.) (coll.) to unintentionally arouse romantic interest (by being solicitous etc)/cf. 放電|放电[fang4 dian4]
to leak/to divulge/to leave out by mistake/waterclock or hourglass (old)
lightning/electricity/electric (bound form)/to get (or give) an electric shock/phone call or telegram etc/to send via telephone or telegram etc

sentences.english: Current liming in a traditional system can present problems with fault coordination.
sentences.chinese: 在傳統系統中電流加石灰會引出漏電配位的問題。

sentences.english: For photoflash lug type low loss factor and low leakage current .
sentences.chinese: 閃光燈用焊片式產品，具有低損耗，低漏電等特點。

sentences.english: Report electrical hazards to the authorities.
sentences.chinese: 向有關人員彙報漏電風險。

sentences.english: The leakage protector in electrical training room is an effective measure to prevent physical shock.
sentences.chinese: 電氣實訓室的漏電保護器是防止人身觸電的有效措施。

sentences.english: Against electric shock are reliable earthing of electrical equipment, any part cannot be leakage.
sentences.chinese: 防觸電電氣設備均要可靠接地，任何部位不能漏電。

sentences.english: This essay expatiates on the harm of low creepage current in coal mines.
sentences.chinese: 闡述了煤礦井下低壓供電網絡漏電電流的產生和危害。

sentences.english: The electric sprayer unit shall be protected against leakage to earth of current liable to cause electrical hazard.
sentences.chinese: 電噴器要裝有防漏電裝置如使用時有觸電危險。

definition: on call/always available/ready at all times
